txt.en: 'Had Ohtar taken the Ring? I had to know!'
Talk to Vágari the Wanderer
'It is gone.'
'It left me, in the water.'
Find some sign that Isildur made for the river-bank
'I am forsaken, and I am free.'
'Tárandil, what is the-'
DNT - Blah!
'All is lost, all is ashes! A thousand curses upon you!\n\n'Without the Ring I cannot fulfill my bond... I cannot save my family! Bravantel, Héol, I tried! I tried, I tried!'
DNT - Blah!
'You are gone with the current... and the Ring with you....'
Talk to Vágari the Wanderer

'I became separated from Isildur during the fighting, and while I was engaged with the Orcs on one flank of our diminishing circle, he gave something to his esquire Ohtar.\n\n'Ohtar vanished during the fighting. Did he escape? And more importantly: what was he given? What was he given?'
'Father! Wait!'
DNT - Blah!
'There are too many!'
DNT - Blah!
Talk to Vágari the Wanderer
'Tárandil! You have to keep fighting! We are going to get through this!\n\n'What did father give to Ohtar? This is not the time for this, brother! Keep fighting!'
Talk to Vágari the Wanderer
'I found him at last, but could make no sense of his expression: mixed pain and elation.'
DNT - Blah!
Hear the words of Vëamacil as remembered by Vágari

'Tárandil, you are alive! Thank the Valar!\n\n'Things go ill for us, brother. Father sent his esquire away before the fighting became too thick, entrusting Ohtar to bear the shards of Narsil away from the battle. But I fear he did not give him the object of the Orc's desire, and if we do not do something they will seize it!'
Listen to Vágari's account
DNT - Blah!
'During the confusion, I lost sight of Isildur. Where had he gone, and did he still have the Ring? If he escaped now, my bargain with the Nazgûl would come to naught!'
'Stand tall, my sons.'
Vágari believed Isildur ran for the river-bank, and he desperately searched for some sign of the king's escape.
Dúnedan Knight
Vágari believed Isildur attempted to swim across the river in order to escape.
'The river-bank! He must have escaped to the river-bank!'
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
'His armour lay among the reeds, discarded. He must have intended to swim!'
'But for men such as me, death was no escape.'
DNT - Blah!
The shade that came to be called Vágari the Wanderer desires to confess to you the misdeeds of his past.
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'Ornaher! No!'
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'Tárandil, you have to protect father! Go!'
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'NO!'
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'He discarded his armour on the bank of the river.'
'Father, do you still have it? Does the Ring remain safe?'
'The Orcs!'
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'Vëamacil... I will...'

'My muscles ached. The swim had taken its toll on me, and I knew I must rest before attempting the return journey. I would hide among the reeds and wait until the Orcs prowling on the distant shore had abandoned their vigil; then I would swim back with my prize.\n\n'Despite my exhaustion, I had to complete the task I had set for myself. It was time.'
'His body... I need his body!'
'Meldaran, the Orcs are too many!'
'He must have been lying!'
'Isildur swam... and I pursued him.'
'I will find it and pry the Ring from his dead hand!'
'As tired as I was, as sick in heart and body as a man can be, I had to finish this.'
'Curse you, Isildur! Curse you!'
'Bravantel and Héol were innocent!'
Swim across the river to find Isildur
Vágari the Wanderer desires to speak to you of his past misdeeds.
'Father, you have to escape! You must bring it to-'
Listen to Vágari's account
Talk to Tárandil
'But for men such as me, death was no escape.'
Instance: The Disaster
Hear the words of Meldaran as remembered by Vágari
